newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Chinese ship sets sail for Taiwan in historic voyage.
newsitem.headline: Chinese ship sets sail for Taiwan in historic voyage.

text.p: The first ship to sail directly to Taiwan from China in more than 40 years has left a southern Chinese port on Saturday and was expected to arrive later in the day, state radio said.
Taiwan port officials said they had yet to receive a formal notice for the ship's entry into a Taiwan port.

The Chinese ship Sheng Da, loaded with cargo, set sail from Xiamen's Haitian port earlier on Saturday morning and was expected to arrive at Taiwan's Kaohsiung port in the south at around 10.00 p.m. (2200 GMT), state radio said.

Taipei on April 11 gave a green light to an initial batch of mainland shippers to cross the heavily militarised ideological divide and Beijing reciprocated on Thursday with unprecedented approvals for six Taiwan carriers.
Direct links would ease a ban enforced by Taiwan's Republic of China government since it lost a civil war to the communists in 1949 and took refuge on the island.
